WizardSections.Name: Section 2
WizardSections.Info: Help Google and other search engines to find your site. Next step will describe each property.

CurrentValues.CurrentValue: Join our team at OTB Expert

OTB Expert is looking for an IT passionate students to join our efforts on one of the most successful projects. You will have the opportunity to work with some of the best professionals around the world and explore amazing technologies. Our products are based on mixed technology in-house solutions that will open you the door for a bright career. Drop a line or send us a CV on office@otb.expert or cv@otb.expert

WizardSections.Name: Section 3
WizardSections.Info: Facebook API id is used to login with Facebook.

WizardSections.Name: Section 3
WizardSections.Info: Google domain id is used for Google Analitycs. Will help you to track users activity.

WizardSections.Name: Section 3
WizardSections.Info: When you post on Facebook, people clicking your post will go to this URL.

WizardSections.Name: Section 3
WizardSections.Info: Facebook posts will show this text as headline.

CurrentValues.CurrentValue: Join our team at OTB Expert

WizardSections.Name: Section 3
WizardSections.Info: This is the image displayed in your facebook posts.

WizardSections.Name: Section 3
WizardSections.Info: Post description will appear under your Facebook posts.

You will have the opportunity to work with some of the best professionals around the world and explore amazing technologies. WizardSections.Name: Section 3
WizardSections.Info: The page title will be displayed in the browser tab.

WizardSections.Name: Section 4
WizardSections.Info: Name the objects you are working with. You will describe them later.

WizardSections.Name: Section 5
WizardSections.Info: Describe the "Experience"

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: The placeholder name is used inside the code as uniqie identifier for your collection. Is better to be CamelCase.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: When your app is loaded only few entries from this collection will be loaded. To define what goes on first load define your filters here.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: A default order can be specified. It is usefull to rank elements in your collection.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: When users are creating new entries, their Id is saved. Authors have full control over entries.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: Use DefaultPage property to preload a specific set of records. Usualy the default page is 0.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: This number specify how many entries will be displayed at a time. For best results should be a multiple of 3.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: Drops are templates for your records. You can clone and edit a drop template from your drops library.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: The type of template

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: How many records do you want to be generated as sample records for your new application?

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: Do you want the table to be regenerated? If you want to save the data you already have in the table make it false. If you don't care about your data in this table make it true and the table will be dropped and recreated.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: Write the name of the database table if it is different than the name of the collection.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: The title of your collection is how users will recognize this collection. Should be human readable and friendly.

WizardSections.Name: Section 6
WizardSections.Info: The id of the collection, unique and camel case.
